sentences.zh: 自古受命帝王，曷嘗不封禪？

translations.literal: From ancient times, emperors and kings who received the mandate, how have they ever not performed feng and shan?
translations.idiomatic: From ancient times, have emperors and kings who received the mandate ever failed to perform the feng and shan sacrifices?

sentences.zh: 蓋有無其應而用事者矣，未有睹符瑞見而不臻乎泰山者也。

translations.literal: There have indeed been those who performed the rituals without their proper omens, but there have never been those who saw auspicious signs appear yet did not proceed to Mount Tai.
translations.idiomatic: There have indeed been those who performed the rituals without their proper omens, but there have never been those who saw auspicious signs appear yet did not proceed to Mount Tai.

sentences.zh: 雖受命而功不至，至梁父矣而德不洽，洽矣而日有不暇給，是以即事用希。

translations.literal: Though received mandate yet merit not reach, reached Liang Fu already yet virtue not harmonious, harmonious already yet days have not sufficient, therefore approach affairs use rare.
translations.idiomatic: Although they received the mandate, their merit did not reach the required level; or they reached Liang Fu but their virtue was not harmonious; or their virtue was harmonious but they had no time to spare. Therefore, the performance of these affairs has been rare.

sentences.zh: 傳曰：「三年不為禮，禮必廢；

translations.literal: Tradition says: 'Three years not do rites, rites certainly waste;'
translations.idiomatic: Tradition says: 'If one does not perform the rites for three years, the rites will certainly be abandoned;

sentences.zh: 三年不為樂，樂必壞。」

translations.literal: Three years not do music, music certainly bad.'
translations.idiomatic: if one does not perform the music for three years, the music will certainly be ruined.'

sentences.zh: 每世之隆，則封禪答焉，及衰而息。

translations.literal: Every generation's prosperity, then feng shan respond there, reach decline then rest.
translations.idiomatic: In every generation's prosperity, the feng and shan sacrifices were performed in response, and when decline came, they ceased.

sentences.zh: 厥曠遠者千有餘載，近者數百載，故其儀闕然堙滅，其詳不可得而記聞云。

translations.literal: Their distant ones thousand have remaining years, near ones several hundred years, therefore their rites lacking completely extinguished, their details cannot obtained and record heard say.
translations.idiomatic: The distant ones span more than a thousand years, the near ones several hundred years. Therefore, their rites have been completely lost and extinguished, and their details cannot be obtained and recorded, it is said.

sentences.zh: 《尚書》曰，舜在璇璣玉衡，以齊七政。

translations.literal: Shang Shu says: Shun at Xuan Ji Yu Heng, with align seven governances.
translations.idiomatic: The Book of Documents says that Shun, using the Xuan Ji and Yu Heng, aligned the seven governances.

sentences.zh: 遂類于上帝，禋于六宗，望山川，遍群神。

translations.literal: Then sacrifice to Supreme God, offer to Six Ancestors, look at mountains rivers, extensively various spirits.
translations.idiomatic: Then he sacrificed to the Supreme God, offered to the Six Ancestors, looked toward the mountains and rivers, and made offerings extensively to the various spirits.

sentences.zh: 輯五瑞，擇吉月日，見四嶽諸牧，還瑞。

translations.literal: Gather five auspicious objects, select lucky months days, see four peaks various shepherds, return auspicious objects.
translations.idiomatic: He gathered the five auspicious objects, selected an auspicious month and day, met with the four peaks and various shepherds, and returned the auspicious objects.

sentences.zh: 歲二月，東巡狩，至于岱宗。

translations.literal: Year second month, east inspect hunt, arrive at Dai Zong.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month of the year, he made an inspection tour to the east and arrived at Dai Zong.

sentences.zh: 岱宗，泰山也。

translations.literal: Dai Zong, Mount Tai also.
translations.idiomatic: Dai Zong is Mount Tai.

sentences.zh: 柴，望秩于山川。

translations.literal: Burnt offering, look at arrange mountains rivers.
translations.idiomatic: He made a burnt offering and looked toward and arranged the mountains and rivers in order.

sentences.zh: 遂覲東后。

translations.literal: Then audience Eastern Lords.
translations.idiomatic: Then he had an audience with the Eastern Lords.

sentences.zh: 東后者，諸侯也。

translations.literal: Eastern Lords, feudal lords also.
translations.idiomatic: The Eastern Lords are the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 合時月正日，同律度量衡，修五禮，五玉三帛二生一死贄。

translations.literal: Unite seasons months correct days, same pitch pipes measures weights, repair five rites, five jades three silks two living one dead offerings.
translations.idiomatic: He unified the seasons, months, and corrected the days, made the same the pitch pipes, measures, and weights, and repaired the five rites, with five jades, three silks, two living and one dead as offerings.

sentences.zh: 五月，巡狩至南嶽。

translations.literal: Fifth month, inspect hunt arrive Southern Peak.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, he made an inspection tour and arrived at the Southern Peak.

sentences.zh: 南嶽，衡山也。

translations.literal: Southern Peak, Mount Heng also.
translations.idiomatic: The Southern Peak is Mount Heng.

sentences.zh: 八月，巡狩至西嶽。

translations.literal: Eighth month, inspect hunt arrive Western Peak.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, he made an inspection tour and arrived at the Western Peak.

sentences.zh: 西嶽，華山也。

translations.literal: Western Peak, Mount Hua also.
translations.idiomatic: The Western Peak is Mount Hua.

sentences.zh: 十一月，巡狩至北嶽。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, inspect hunt arrive Northern Peak.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, he made an inspection tour and arrived at the Northern Peak.

sentences.zh: 北岳，恒山也。

translations.literal: Northern Peak, Mount Heng also.
translations.idiomatic: The Northern Peak is Mount Heng.

sentences.zh: 皆如岱宗之禮。

translations.literal: All like Dai Zong rites.
translations.idiomatic: All were performed like the rites at Dai Zong.

sentences.zh: 中嶽，嵩高也。

translations.literal: Central Peak, Song Gao also.
translations.idiomatic: The Central Peak is Song Gao.

sentences.zh: 五載一巡狩。

translations.literal: Five years one inspect hunt.
translations.idiomatic: Every five years, he made one inspection tour.

sentences.zh: 禹遵之。

translations.literal: Yu follow it.
translations.idiomatic: Yu followed this.

sentences.zh: 後十四世，至帝孔甲，淫德好神，神瀆，二龍去之。

translations.literal: After fourteen generations, arrive Emperor Kong Jia, licentious virtue fond spirits, spirits profane, two dragons leave him.
translations.idiomatic: After fourteen generations, they reached Emperor Kong Jia, who had licentious virtue and was fond of spirits. The spirits were profaned, and two dragons left him.

sentences.zh: 其後三世，湯伐桀，欲遷夏社，不可，作夏社。

translations.literal: Its after three generations, Tang attack Jie, wish move Xia altar, not possible, make Xia altar.
translations.idiomatic: After three generations, Tang attacked Jie and wished to move the Xia altar, but it was not possible, so he made the Xia altar.

sentences.zh: 後八世，至帝太戊，有桑谷生於廷，一暮大拱，懼。

translations.literal: After eight generations, arrive Emperor Tai Wu, have mulberry millet grow in courtyard, one evening large embrace, fear.
translations.idiomatic: After eight generations, they reached Emperor Tai Wu. There were mulberry and millet growing in the courtyard, and in one evening they grew large enough to embrace. He was afraid.

sentences.zh: 伊陟曰：「妖不勝德。」

translations.literal: Yi Zhi say: 'Monsters not overcome virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: Yi Zhi said, 'Monsters cannot overcome virtue.'

sentences.zh: 太戊修德，桑谷死。

translations.literal: Tai Wu cultivate virtue, mulberry millet die.
translations.idiomatic: Tai Wu cultivated virtue, and the mulberry and millet died.

sentences.zh: 伊陟贊巫咸，巫咸之興自此始。

translations.literal: Yi Zhi assist Wu Xian, Wu Xian's rise from this begin.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Zhi assisted Wu Xian, and Wu Xian's rise began from this.

sentences.zh: 後十四世，帝武丁得傅說為相，殷復興焉，稱高宗。

translations.literal: After fourteen generations, Emperor Wu Ding obtain Fu Yue as chancellor, Yin revive there, call Gao Zong.
translations.idiomatic: After fourteen generations, Emperor Wu Ding obtained Fu Yue as chancellor, and Yin was revived. He was called the Gao Zong.

sentences.zh: 有雉登鼎耳雊，武丁懼。

translations.literal: Have pheasant climb cauldron ear crow, Wu Ding fear.
translations.idiomatic: A pheasant climbed onto the cauldron's ear and crowed, and Wu Ding was afraid.

sentences.zh: 祖己曰：「修德。」

translations.literal: Zu Ji say: 'Cultivate virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: Zu Ji said, 'Cultivate virtue.'

sentences.zh: 武丁從之，位以永寧。

translations.literal: Wu Ding follow it, position with eternal peace.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ding followed it, and his position was eternally peaceful.

sentences.zh: 後五世，帝武乙慢神而震死。

translations.literal: After five generations, Emperor Wu Yi disrespect spirits and thunder die.
translations.idiomatic: After five generations, Emperor Wu Yi disrespected the spirits and died by thunder.

sentences.zh: 後三世，帝紂淫亂，武王伐之。

translations.literal: After three generations, Emperor Zhou licentious disorder, Wu Wang attack him.
translations.idiomatic: After three generations, Emperor Zhou was licentious and disorderly, and King Wu attacked him.

sentences.zh: 由此觀之，始未嘗不肅祗，後稍怠慢也。

translations.literal: From this observe, beginning never not reverent respectful, after gradually negligent also.
translations.idiomatic: From this, one can observe that in the beginning they were never not reverent and respectful, but afterward they gradually became negligent.

sentences.zh: 周官曰，冬日至，祀天於南郊，迎長日之至；

translations.literal: Zhou officials say: winter solstice arrive, sacrifice heaven at southern suburb, welcome long day arrive;
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou officials say that when the winter solstice arrives, one sacrifices to heaven at the southern suburb to welcome the arrival of the long day;

sentences.zh: 夏日至，祭地祗。

translations.literal: Summer solstice arrive, sacrifice earth spirits.
translations.idiomatic: when the summer solstice arrives, one sacrifices to the earth spirits.

sentences.zh: 皆用樂舞，而神乃可得而禮也。

translations.literal: All use music dance, and spirits then can obtain and ritual also.
translations.idiomatic: All use music and dance, and then the spirits can be obtained and ritually honored.

sentences.zh: 天子祭天下名山大川，五嶽視三公，四瀆視諸侯，諸侯祭其疆內名山大川。

translations.literal: Emperor sacrifice all under heaven famous mountains great rivers, five peaks regard three dukes, four rivers regard feudal lords, feudal lords sacrifice their territory within famous mountains great rivers.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven sacrifices to the famous mountains and great rivers of all under heaven. The five peaks are regarded as the three dukes, and the four rivers are regarded as the feudal lords. The feudal lords sacrifice to the famous mountains and great rivers within their territories.

sentences.zh: 四瀆者，江、河、淮、濟也。

translations.literal: Four rivers, Jiang, He, Huai, Ji also.
translations.idiomatic: The four rivers are the Jiang, He, Huai, and Ji.

sentences.zh: 天子曰明堂、辟雍，諸侯曰泮宮。

translations.literal: Emperor call Bright Hall, Pi Yong, feudal lords call Pan Palace.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven calls them the Bright Hall and Pi Yong; the feudal lords call them the Pan Palace.

sentences.zh: 周公既相成王，郊祀后稷以配天，宗祀文王於明堂以配上帝。

translations.literal: Zhou Gong already chancellor Cheng Wang, suburban sacrifice Hou Ji to match heaven, ancestral sacrifice Wen Wang at Bright Hall to match Supreme God.
translations.idiomatic: After the Duke of Zhou became chancellor to King Cheng, he performed suburban sacrifices to Hou Ji to match heaven, and ancestral sacrifices to King Wen at the Bright Hall to match the Supreme God.

sentences.zh: 自禹興而修社祀，后稷稼穡，故有稷祠，郊社所從來尚矣。

translations.literal: From Yu rise and repair altar sacrifices, Hou Ji plow harvest, therefore have Ji sacrifices, suburban altar what from come ancient already.
translations.idiomatic: From Yu's rise, the altar sacrifices were repaired. Hou Ji plowed and harvested, and therefore there were Ji sacrifices. The suburban altar has been ancient from its origin.

sentences.zh: 自周克殷後十四世，世益衰，禮樂廢，諸侯恣行，而幽王為犬戎所敗，周東徙雒邑。

translations.literal: From Zhou conquer Yin after fourteen generations, generations increasingly decline, rites music abandon, feudal lords wantonly act, and You Wang by Quanrong defeated, Zhou east move Luo yi.
translations.idiomatic: From Zhou's conquest of Yin, after fourteen generations, the generations increasingly declined, rites and music were abandoned, and the feudal lords acted wantonly. King You was defeated by the Quanrong, and Zhou moved east to Luoyi.

sentences.zh: 秦襄公攻戎救周，始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Qin Xiang Gong attack Rong save Zhou, begin ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang of Qin attacked the Rong and saved Zhou, and began to be ranked among the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 秦襄公既侯，居西垂，自以為主少皞之神，作西畤，祠白帝，其牲用騮駒黃牛羝羊各一云。

translations.literal: Qin Xiang Gong already marquis, dwell west border, self consider master Shao Hao god, make west altar, sacrifice White Emperor, his victims use sorrel colt yellow ox ram sheep each one say.
translations.idiomatic: After Duke Xiang of Qin became a marquis, he dwelt at the western border and considered himself master of Shao Hao's god. He made the Western Altar and sacrificed to the White Emperor, using as victims one sorrel colt, one yellow ox, and one ram, it is said.

sentences.zh: 其後十六年，秦文公東獵汧渭之閒，卜居之而吉。

translations.literal: Its after sixteen years, Qin Wen Gong east hunt Qian Wei between, divine dwell it and auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: After sixteen years, Duke Wen of Qin hunted to the east between the Qian and Wei rivers, divined about dwelling there, and it was auspicious.

sentences.zh: 文公夢黃蛇自天下屬地，其口止於鄜衍。

translations.literal: Wen Gong dream yellow snake from heaven reach earth, its mouth stop at Fu Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen dreamed of a yellow snake descending from heaven to earth, and its mouth stopped at Fu Yan.

sentences.zh: 文公問史敦，敦曰：「此上帝之徵，君其祠之。」

translations.literal: Wen Gong ask Shi Dun, Dun say: 'This Supreme God sign, lord should sacrifice it.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen asked Shi Dun, and Dun said, 'This is a sign from the Supreme God. You should sacrifice to it.'

sentences.zh: 於是作鄜畤，用三牲郊祭白帝焉。

translations.literal: Therefore make Fu altar, use three victims suburban sacrifice White Emperor there.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, he made the Fu Altar and used three victims to perform suburban sacrifices to the White Emperor there.

sentences.zh: 自未作鄜畤也，而雍旁故有吳陽武畤，雍東有好畤，皆廢無祠。

translations.literal: From not yet make Fu altar also, and Yong beside originally have Wu Yang Wu altar, Yong east have Hao altar, all abandoned no sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: Before the Fu Altar was made, beside Yong there were originally the Wu Yang and Wu altars, and to the east of Yong there was the Hao Altar. All were abandoned with no sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 或曰：「自古以雍州積高，神明之隩，故立畤郊上帝，諸神祠皆聚云。

translations.literal: Some say: 'From ancient with Yong province piled high, spirits bright recess, therefore establish altar suburban Supreme God, various spirits sacrifices all gather say.'
translations.idiomatic: Some say, 'From ancient times, Yong Province has been piled high, a recess of the spirits and the bright. Therefore, altars were established for suburban sacrifices to the Supreme God, and the various spirit sacrifices all gathered there, it is said.

sentences.zh: 蓋黃帝時嘗用事，雖晚周亦郊焉。」

translations.literal: Probably Yellow Emperor time once perform affairs, though late Zhou also suburban there.'
translations.idiomatic: Probably in the time of the Yellow Emperor, affairs were once performed there, and though it was late Zhou, suburban sacrifices were also performed there.'

sentences.zh: 其語不經見，縉紳者不道。

translations.literal: Its words not pass seen, noble scholars not speak.
translations.idiomatic: These words are not commonly seen, and noble scholars do not speak of them.

sentences.zh: 作鄜畤後九年，文公獲若石雲，于陳倉北阪城祠之。

translations.literal: Make Fu altar after nine years, Wen Gong obtain like stone cloud, at Chen Cang north slope city sacrifice it.
translations.idiomatic: Nine years after making the Fu Altar, Duke Wen obtained something like a stone cloud and sacrificed to it at the city on the northern slope of Chen Cang.

sentences.zh: 其神或歲不至，或歲數來，來也常以夜，光輝若流星，從東南來集于祠城，則若雄雞，其聲殷雲，野雞夜雊。

translations.literal: Its spirit or year not arrive, or year several come, come also often with night, radiance like shooting star, from southeast come gather at sacrifice city, then like male chicken, its sound deep cloud, wild chickens night crow.
translations.idiomatic: Its spirit sometimes did not arrive in a year, or sometimes came several times in a year. When it came, it was often at night, with radiance like a shooting star, coming from the southeast to gather at the sacrifice city. Then it was like a male chicken, its sound deep as clouds, and wild chickens crowed at night.

sentences.zh: 以一牢祠，命曰陳寶。

translations.literal: With one livestock set sacrifice, name say Chen Bao.
translations.idiomatic: He sacrificed with one set of livestock and named it Chen Bao.

sentences.zh: 作鄜畤後七十八年，秦德公既立，卜居雍，「後子孫飲馬於河」，遂都雍。

translations.literal: Make Fu altar after seventy-eight years, Qin De Gong already established, divine dwell Yong, 'later descendants drink horses at river,' then capital Yong.
translations.idiomatic: Seventy-eight years after making the Fu Altar, Duke De of Qin was established. He divined about dwelling at Yong, and the divination said, 'Later descendants will water their horses at the river.' Therefore, he made Yong the capital.

sentences.zh: 雍之諸祠自此興。

translations.literal: Yong's various sacrifices from this rise.
translations.idiomatic: The various sacrifices at Yong rose from this.

sentences.zh: 用三百牢於鄜畤。

translations.literal: Use three hundred livestock sets at Fu altar.
translations.idiomatic: He used three hundred sets of livestock at the Fu Altar.

sentences.zh: 作伏祠。

translations.literal: Make Fu sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: He made the Fu sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 磔狗邑四門，以御蠱菑。

translations.literal: Split dogs city four gates, to defend against gu disasters.
translations.idiomatic: He split dogs at the four gates of the city to defend against gu disasters.

sentences.zh: 德公立二年卒。

translations.literal: De Gong established two years die.
translations.idiomatic: Duke De was established for two years and then died.

sentences.zh: 其後（六）［四］年，秦宣公作密畤於渭南，祭青帝。

translations.literal: Its after four years, Qin Xuan Gong make Mi altar at Wei south, sacrifice Qing Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: After four years, Duke Xuan of Qin made the Mi Altar south of the Wei and sacrificed to the Green Emperor.

sentences.zh: 其後十四年，秦繆公立，病臥五日不寤；

translations.literal: Its after fourteen years, Qin Mu Gong established, ill lie five days not awake;
translations.idiomatic: After fourteen years, Duke Mu of Qin was established. The duke was ill and lay for five days without waking;

sentences.zh: 寤，乃言夢見上帝，上帝命繆公平晉亂。

translations.literal: Awake, then speak dream see Supreme God, Supreme God command Mu Gong pacify Jin disorder.
translations.idiomatic: when he awoke, he spoke of dreaming that he saw the Supreme God, and the Supreme God commanded Duke Mu to pacify the disorder in Jin.

sentences.zh: 史書而記藏之府。

translations.literal: Scribe write and record store in treasury.
translations.idiomatic: The scribe wrote and recorded it and stored it in the treasury.

sentences.zh: 而後世皆曰秦繆公上天。

translations.literal: And later generations all say Qin Mu Gong ascended heaven.
translations.idiomatic: And later generations all said that Duke Mu of Qin ascended to heaven.

sentences.zh: 秦繆公即位九年，齊桓公既霸，會諸侯於葵丘，而欲封禪。

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong ascended position nine years, Qi Huan Gong already hegemon, assemble feudal lords at Kui Qiu, and wish feng shan.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year after Duke Mu of Qin ascended the position, Duke Huan of Qi was already hegemon. He assembled the feudal lords at Kui Qiu and wished to perform the feng and shan sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 管仲曰：「古者封泰山禪梁父者七十二家，而夷吾所記者十有二焉。

translations.literal: Guan Zhong say: 'Ancient ones feng Tai Shan shan Liang Fu ones seventy-two families, and Yi Wu what recorded ones ten have two there.'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Zhong said, 'In ancient times, those who performed the feng at Mount Tai and the shan at Liang Fu numbered seventy-two families, and of what Yi Wu recorded, there are twelve of them.

sentences.zh: 昔無懷氏封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Former Wu Huai clan feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Formerly, the Wu Huai clan performed feng at Mount Tai and shan at Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 虙羲封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Fu Xi feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Fu Xi performed the feng at Mount Tai and the shan at Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 神農封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Shen Nong feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Shen Nong performed the feng at Mount Tai and the shan at Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 炎帝封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Yan Emperor feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: The Yan Emperor performed the feng at Mount Tai and the shan at Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 黃帝封泰山，禪亭亭；

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor feng Tai Shan, shan Ting Ting;
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor performed the feng at Mount Tai and the shan at Ting Ting;

sentences.zh: 顓頊封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Zhuan Xu feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Zhuan Xu performed the feng at Mount Tai and the shan at Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 帝嚳封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Emperor Ku feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Ku performed the feng at Mount Tai and the shan at Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 堯封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Yao feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Yao performed the feng at Mount Tai and the shan at Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 舜封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Shun feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Shun performed the feng at Mount Tai and the shan at Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 禹封泰山，禪會稽；

translations.literal: Yu feng Tai Shan, shan Kui Ji;
translations.idiomatic: Yu performed the feng at Mount Tai and the shan at Kui Ji;

sentences.zh: 湯封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Tang feng Tai Shan, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Tang performed the feng at Mount Tai and the shan at Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 周成王封泰山，禪社首：皆受命然後得封禪。」

translations.literal: Zhou Cheng Wang feng Tai Shan, shan She Shou: all received mandate then obtain feng shan.'
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng of Zhou performed the feng at Mount Tai and the shan at She Shou. All received the mandate and then were able to perform the feng and shan.'

sentences.zh: 桓公曰：「寡人北伐山戎，過孤竹；

translations.literal: Huan Gong say: 'I north attack Shan Rong, pass Gu Zhu;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan said, 'I attacked the Shan Rong in the north and passed Gu Zhu;

sentences.zh: 西伐大夏，涉流沙，束馬懸車，上卑耳之山；

translations.literal: West attack Da Xia, ford flowing sands, bind horses hang chariots, ascend Bei Er mountain;
translations.idiomatic: I attacked Da Xia in the west, forded the flowing sands, bound the horses and hung the chariots, and ascended Mount Bei Er;

sentences.zh: 欒大，膠東宮人，故嘗與文成將軍同師，已而為膠東王尚方。

translations.literal: Luan Da, Jiaodong palace person, formerly once with Wen Cheng general same teacher, then became Jiaodong Wang director of medicine.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Da was a palace attendant in Jiaodong who had once studied under the same teacher as General Wencheng, and later became the director of medicine for the King of Jiaodong.

sentences.zh: 而樂成侯姊為康王后，無子。

translations.literal: And Le Cheng Hou sister was Kang Wang queen, no children.
translations.idiomatic: The sister of the Marquis of Lecheng was the queen of King Kang, but she had no children.

sentences.zh: 康王死，他姬子立為王。

translations.literal: Kang Wang died, other concubine son established as king.
translations.idiomatic: When King Kang died, the son of another concubine was established as king.

sentences.zh: 而康后有淫行，與王不相中，相危以法。

translations.literal: And Kang queen had licentious behavior, with king not compatible, mutually threatened with law.
translations.idiomatic: The Queen of Kang had engaged in licentious behavior and was incompatible with the new king, so they threatened each other with legal action.

sentences.zh: 康后聞文成已死，而欲自媚於上，乃遣欒大因樂成侯求見言方。

translations.literal: Kang queen heard Wen Cheng already dead, and wished self flatter emperor, then sent Luan Da through Le Cheng Hou sought audience spoke methods.
translations.idiomatic: When the Queen of Kang heard that Wencheng had died, and wishing to ingratiate herself with the emperor, she sent Luan Da through the Marquis of Lecheng to seek an audience and speak of his methods.

sentences.zh: 天子既誅文成，後悔其蚤死，惜其方不盡，及見欒大，大說。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven already executed Wen Cheng, later regretted his early death, pitied his methods not complete, when saw Luan Da, greatly pleased.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven had executed Wencheng, but later regretted his early death and lamented that his methods were incomplete. When he saw Luan Da, he was greatly pleased.

sentences.zh: 大為人長美，言多方略，而敢為大言處之不疑。

translations.literal: Da as person tall beautiful, speech many strategies, and dared make big words handle without doubt.
translations.idiomatic: Da was a tall and handsome man whose speech contained many strategies, and he dared to make grand claims, handling them without hesitation.

sentences.zh: 大言曰：「臣常往來海中，見安期、羨門之屬。

translations.literal: Da said: 'Minister constantly came went sea middle, saw An Qi, Xianmen kind.
translations.idiomatic: Da said: 'Your servant has often traveled to the sea, where I have seen the likes of Anqi and Xianmen.

sentences.zh: 顧以臣為賤，不信臣。

translations.literal: Only because minister base, not believe minister.
translations.idiomatic: But because they considered your servant base, they did not believe me.

sentences.zh: 又以為康王諸侯耳，不足與方。

translations.literal: Also thought Kang Wang feudal lord only, not worth with methods.
translations.idiomatic: They also thought that King Kang was merely a feudal lord and not worthy of sharing these methods.

sentences.zh: 臣數言康王，康王又不用臣。

translations.literal: Minister several times spoke Kang Wang, Kang Wang again not use minister.
translations.idiomatic: Your servant spoke to King Kang several times, but King Kang did not employ me.

sentences.zh: 臣之師曰：『黃金可成，而河決可塞，不死之藥可得，僊人可致也。』

translations.literal: Minister teacher said: 'Gold can be made, and Yellow River breach can be blocked, immortality medicine can be obtained, immortals can be brought.'
translations.idiomatic: My teacher said: 'Gold can be made, the Yellow River breach can be blocked, the elixir of immortality can be obtained, and immortals can be summoned.'

sentences.zh: 然臣恐效文成，則方士皆奄口，惡敢言方哉！」

translations.literal: But minister feared follow Wen Cheng, then fangshi all shut mouths, how dare speak methods!'
translations.idiomatic: However, your servant fears that if I follow Wencheng's example, then all the fangshi will shut their mouths, and who would dare speak of these methods?'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「文成食馬肝死耳。

translations.literal: Emperor said: 'Wen Cheng ate horse liver died only.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: 'Wencheng died from eating horse liver.

sentences.zh: 子誠能修其方，我何愛乎！」

translations.literal: You truly can practice his methods, I what begrudge!'
translations.idiomatic: If you can truly practice his methods, what would I begrudge you?'

sentences.zh: 大曰：「臣師非有求人，人者求之。

translations.literal: Da said: 'Minister teacher not seeks people, people seek him.
translations.idiomatic: Da said: 'My teacher does not seek out people; rather, people are the ones who seek him.

sentences.zh: 陛下必欲致之，則貴其使者，令有親屬，以客禮待之，勿卑，使各佩其信印，乃可使通言於神人。

translations.literal: Your Majesty must want obtain them, then honor their envoys, make have relatives, with guest rites treat them, do not belittle, make each wear their trust seals, then can make communicate words to god people.
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty truly wishes to obtain them, then you must honor their envoys, give them relatives, treat them with the rites due to guests, and not belittle them. Make each wear their trust seals, and only then can they communicate with the divine beings.

sentences.zh: 神人尚肯邪不邪。

translations.literal: God people still willing or not.
translations.idiomatic: Whether the divine beings are willing or not depends on this.

sentences.zh: 致尊其使，然後可致也。」

translations.literal: Make honor their envoys, then can obtain.'
translations.idiomatic: Only by honoring their envoys can they be obtained.'

sentences.zh: 於是上使驗小方，鬬棋，棋自相觸擊。

translations.literal: Therefore emperor made test small methods, fighting chess, chess self mutually struck hit.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon, the emperor had him demonstrate a small method: fighting chess pieces that moved and struck each other on their own.

sentences.zh: 是時上方憂河決，而黃金不就，乃拜大為五利將軍。

translations.literal: This time emperor just worried Yellow River breach, and gold not completed, then appointed Da as Five Benefits general.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the emperor was worried about the Yellow River breach, and the gold had not been completed, so he appointed Da as General of the Five Benefits.

sentences.zh: 居月餘，得四印，佩天士將軍、地士將軍、大通將軍印。

translations.literal: Dwelt month remaining, got four seals, wore Heaven Soldier general, Earth Soldier general, Great Passage general seals.
translations.idiomatic: After a little more than a month, he obtained four seals, wearing those of General of Heaven's Soldiers, General of Earth's Soldiers, and General of Great Passage.

sentences.zh: 制詔御史：「昔禹疏九江，決四瀆。

translations.literal: Formulated edict imperial secretaries: 'Formerly Yu dredged nine rivers, opened four estuaries.
translations.idiomatic: An edict was issued to the imperial secretaries: 'In ancient times, Yu dredged the nine rivers and opened the four estuaries.

sentences.zh: 閒者河溢皋陸，隄繇不息。

translations.literal: Recently Yellow River overflowed Gao Lu, dike labor not ceased.
translations.idiomatic: Recently, the Yellow River overflowed at Gaolu, and the dike labor has not ceased.

sentences.zh: 朕臨天下二十有八年，天若遺朕士而大通焉。

translations.literal: I ruled world twenty eight years, heaven if sent me scholar and greatly passed.
translations.idiomatic: I have ruled the world for twenty-eight years. If Heaven has sent me a scholar, then great passage has been achieved.

sentences.zh: 乾稱『蜚龍』，『鴻漸于般』，朕意庶幾與焉。

translations.literal: Qian says 'flying dragon', 'hong gradually to ban', my intent perhaps with that.
translations.idiomatic: Qian speaks of the 'flying dragon' and 'the wild goose gradually advances to the bank.' My intent is perhaps in accord with this.

sentences.zh: 其以二千戶封地士將軍大為樂通侯。」

translations.literal: Should with two thousand households seal Earth Soldier general Da as Le Tong hou.'
translations.idiomatic: Let the General of Earth's Soldiers, Da, be enfeoffed with two thousand households as the Marquis of Letong.'

sentences.zh: 賜列侯甲第，僮千人。

translations.literal: Granted marquises first mansions, youths thousand.
translations.idiomatic: He was granted a first-class mansion befitting a marquis, along with a thousand servants.

sentences.zh: 乘轝斥車馬帷幄器物以充其家。

translations.literal: Rode sedan chair excluded chariots horses curtains tents utensils to fill his house.
translations.idiomatic: Sedan chairs, chariots, horses, curtains, tents, and utensils were provided to fill his household.

sentences.zh: 又以衛長公主妻之，齎金萬斤，更命其邑曰當利公主。

translations.literal: Again with Wei long princess married him, provided gold ten thousand catties, moreover named his city Dang Li princess.
translations.idiomatic: He was also given the eldest princess of Wei in marriage, along with ten thousand catties of gold, and his city was renamed Princess Dangli.

sentences.zh: 天子親如五利之第。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven personally went to Five Benefits residence.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven personally visited the residence of the General of the Five Benefits.

sentences.zh: 使者存問供給，相屬於道。

translations.literal: Envoys visited supplied, connected on road.
translations.idiomatic: Envoys came to visit and supply him, one after another on the road.

sentences.zh: 自大主將相以下，皆置酒其家，獻遺之。

translations.literal: From great chief generals ministers below, all placed wine his house, offered gifts to him.
translations.idiomatic: From the great chiefs, generals, and ministers on down, all came to his house to offer wine and present gifts to him.

sentences.zh: 於是天子又刻玉印曰「天道將軍」，使使衣羽衣，夜立白茅上，五利將軍亦衣羽衣，夜立白茅上受印，以示不臣也。

translations.literal: Therefore Son of Heaven again carved jade seal said 'Heaven Dao general', sent envoy wore feather clothes, night stood white thatch above, Five Benefits general also wore feather clothes, night stood white thatch above received seal, to show not subject.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon, the Son of Heaven again carved a jade seal inscribed 'General of the Way of Heaven.' He sent an envoy wearing feathered robes to stand on white thatch at night, and the General of the Five Benefits also wore feathered robes and stood on white thatch at night to receive the seal, to show that he was not a subject.

sentences.zh: 而佩「天道」者，且為天子道天神也。

translations.literal: And wearing 'Heaven Dao' ones, moreover for Son of Heaven guided heaven gods.
translations.idiomatic: Those who wear the 'Way of Heaven' seal are to guide the heavenly gods for the Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 於是五利常夜祠其家，欲以下神。

translations.literal: Therefore Five Benefits constantly night sacrificed his house, wished to descend gods.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon, the General of the Five Benefits often performed sacrifices at night in his house, wishing to summon the gods.

sentences.zh: 神未至而百鬼集矣，然頗能使之。

translations.literal: Gods not arrived but hundred ghosts gathered, yet considerably could make them.
translations.idiomatic: The gods did not arrive, but a hundred ghosts gathered instead. Nevertheless, he was quite able to command them.

sentences.zh: 其後裝治行，東入海，求其師云。

translations.literal: Its after prepared went, east entered sea, sought his teacher says.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward, he prepared for a journey and went east into the sea to seek his teacher, it is said.

sentences.zh: 大見數月，佩六印，貴震天下，而海上燕齊之閒，莫不搤捥而自言有禁方，能神僊矣。

translations.literal: Da appeared several months, wore six seals, nobility shook world, and sea Yan Qi between, none not gripped and self claimed had forbidden methods, could god immortal.
translations.idiomatic: Da appeared for several months, wearing six seals, and his nobility shook the world. Among those between Yan and Qi on the sea, there was none who did not grip their wrists and claim to have forbidden methods and the ability to become divine immortals.

sentences.zh: 其夏六月中，汾陰巫錦為民祠魏脽后土營旁，見地如鉤狀，掊視得鼎。

translations.literal: That summer sixth month middle, Fen Yin shaman Jin for people sacrificed Wei Wei Hou Tu camp beside, saw ground like hook shape, dug looked got ding.
translations.idiomatic: In the middle of the sixth month of that summer, the shaman Jin of Fenyin was performing sacrifices for the people beside the camp of the Hou Tu at Wei Shui when he saw the ground in the shape of a hook. Digging and looking, he found a ding.

sentences.zh: 鼎大異於眾鼎，文鏤無款識，怪之，言吏。

translations.literal: Ding greatly different from crowd dings, patterns engraved no inscriptions, considered strange, told official.
translations.idiomatic: The ding was greatly different from other dings, with engraved patterns but no inscriptions. Finding it strange, he reported it to the official.

sentences.zh: 吏告河東太守勝，勝以聞。

translations.literal: Official told Hedong governor Sheng, Sheng reported it.
translations.idiomatic: The official told the governor of Hedong, Sheng, and Sheng reported it to the emperor.

sentences.zh: 天子使使驗問巫得鼎無姦詐，乃以禮祠，迎鼎至甘泉，從行，上薦之。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven sent envoy verified questioned shaman obtained ding no deceit fraud, then with rites sacrificed, welcomed ding to Gan Quan, followed journey, emperor offered it.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven sent an envoy to verify and question the shaman about how the ding was obtained, finding no deceit or fraud. Then, with proper rites, he sacrificed and welcomed the ding to Ganquan, following along on the journey, and the emperor offered it.

sentences.zh: 至中山，曣溫，有黃云蓋焉。

translations.literal: Arrived Zhongshan, warm mist, had yellow cloud covering.
translations.idiomatic: When they arrived at Zhongshan, there was warm mist, and a yellow cloud covered them.

sentences.zh: 有麃過，上自射之，因以祭云。

translations.literal: Had deer passed, emperor personally shot it, thus used to sacrifice says.
translations.idiomatic: A deer passed by, and the emperor personally shot it, using it for the sacrifice, it is said.

sentences.zh: 至長安，公卿大夫皆議請尊寶鼎。

translations.literal: Arrived Chang'an, dukes ministers officials all discussed requested honored treasure ding.
translations.idiomatic: When they arrived at Chang'an, the dukes, ministers, and officials all discussed and requested that the treasure ding be honored.

sentences.zh: 天子曰：「閒者河溢，歲數不登，故巡祭后土，祈為百姓育穀。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven said: 'Recently Yellow River overflowed, years several not good harvest, therefore toured sacrificed Hou Tu, prayed for common people nurture grains.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven said: 'Recently, the Yellow River overflowed, and for several years the harvests have not been good. Therefore, I toured and sacrificed to Hou Tu, praying to nurture grain for the common people.

sentences.zh: 今歲豐廡未報，鼎曷為出哉？」

translations.literal: Now year abundant not yet reported, ding why come out?'
translations.idiomatic: Now the year has been abundant, but this has not yet been reported. Why has the ding appeared?'

sentences.zh: 有司皆曰：「聞昔泰帝興神鼎一，一者壹統，天地萬物所系終也。

translations.literal: Officials all said: 'Heard formerly Tai Emperor raised divine ding one, one is unify, heaven earth ten thousand things attached end.
translations.idiomatic: The officials all said: 'We have heard that in ancient times, the Tai Emperor raised one divine ding. The number one represents unity, and it is what all things in heaven and earth are bound to and end with.

sentences.zh: 黃帝作寶鼎三，象天地人。

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor made treasure dings three, symbolized heaven earth person.
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor made three treasure dings, symbolizing heaven, earth, and man.

sentences.zh: 禹收九牧之金，鑄九鼎。

translations.literal: Yu collected nine provinces gold, cast nine dings.
translations.idiomatic: Yu collected the gold of the nine provinces and cast nine dings.

sentences.zh: 皆嘗亨鬺上帝鬼神。

translations.literal: All once cooked offered Shang Di ghosts gods.
translations.idiomatic: All of them were once used to cook and offer to Shang Di and the ghosts and gods.

sentences.zh: 遭聖則興，鼎遷于夏商。

translations.literal: Met sage then rose, dings moved to Xia Shang.
translations.idiomatic: When they encountered a sage, they rose, and the dings moved to Xia and Shang.

sentences.zh: 周德衰，宋之社亡，鼎乃淪沒，伏而不見。

translations.literal: Zhou virtue declined, Song altar perished, dings then sank submerged, hid not seen.
translations.idiomatic: When the virtue of Zhou declined and the altar of Song perished, the dings then sank and were submerged, hidden and not seen.

sentences.zh: 頌云『自堂徂基，自羊徂牛；

translations.literal: Ode says 'from hall to foundation, from sheep to ox;
translations.idiomatic: The Ode says: 'From the hall to the foundation, from sheep to ox;

sentences.zh: 鼐鼎及鼒，不吳不驁，胡考之休』。

translations.literal: Nai ding and nao, not Wu not Ao, Hu long its good.'
translations.idiomatic: The nai ding and the nao, not boisterous, not proud—may the long life be blessed.'

sentences.zh: 今鼎至甘泉，光潤龍變，承休無疆。

translations.literal: Now ding arrived Gan Quan, light moist dragon changed, received good without limit.
translations.idiomatic: Now the ding has arrived at Ganquan, shining and moist, transformed like a dragon, receiving blessings without limit.

sentences.zh: 合茲中山，有黃白云降蓋，若獸為符，路弓乘矢，集獲壇下，報祠大享。

translations.literal: Met this Zhongshan, had yellow white clouds descended covered, like beast for sign, road bow riding arrow, gathered obtained altar below, report sacrifice great feast.
translations.idiomatic: Meeting this at Zhongshan, yellow and white clouds descended and covered them, with beasts as signs. The road bow and riding arrows gathered and were obtained at the altar below, and a great feast was held in response to the sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 唯受命而帝者心知其意而合德焉。

translations.literal: Only received mandate and emperor ones heart know its meaning and united virtue there.
translations.idiomatic: Only those who have received the mandate and become emperor know its meaning in their hearts and unite with virtue.

sentences.zh: 鼎宜見於祖禰，藏於帝廷，以合明應。」

translations.literal: Ding should appear at ancestors, hidden at emperor court, to unite bright response.'
translations.idiomatic: The ding should be presented to the ancestors and hidden in the imperial court, to unite with the bright response.'

sentences.zh: 制曰：「可。」

translations.literal: Edict said: 'Acceptable.'
translations.idiomatic: The edict said: 'Approved.'

sentences.zh: 入海求蓬萊者，言蓬萊不遠，而不能至者，殆不見其氣。

translations.literal: Entered sea sought Penglai ones, said Penglai not far, but cannot reach ones, probably not seen its qi.
translations.idiomatic: Those who entered the sea seeking Penglai said that Penglai was not far, but those who could not reach it probably did not see its qi.

sentences.zh: 上乃遣望氣佐候其氣云。

translations.literal: Emperor then sent qi-watchers assistants to await its qi says.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then sent qi-watchers and assistants to await its qi, it is said.

sentences.zh: 其秋，上幸雍，且郊。

translations.literal: That autumn, emperor went to Yong, about to suburban sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: That autumn, the emperor went to Yong and was about to perform the suburban sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 或曰「五帝，太一之佐也，宜立太一而上親郊之」。

translations.literal: Someone said 'Five Emperors are Tai Yi assistants, should establish Tai Yi and emperor personally suburban sacrifice it.'
translations.idiomatic: Someone said: 'The Five Emperors are assistants to Tai Yi. We should establish Tai Yi and the emperor should personally perform the suburban sacrifice to it.'

sentences.zh: 上疑未定。

translations.literal: Emperor doubt not decided.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor was doubtful and had not decided.

sentences.zh: 齊人公孫卿曰：「今年得寶鼎，其冬辛巳朔旦冬至，與黃帝時等。」

translations.literal: Qi person Gongsun Qing said: 'This year obtained treasure ding, its winter Xin Si first day winter solstice, with Yellow Emperor time equal.'
translations.idiomatic: Gongsun Qing of Qi said: 'This year we obtained the treasure ding, and in winter, on the first day of the month Xin Si, the winter solstice occurred, which is equal to the time of the Yellow Emperor.'

sentences.zh: 卿有札書曰：「黃帝得寶鼎宛朐，問於鬼臾區。

translations.literal: Qing has bamboo book said: 'Yellow Emperor obtained treasure ding Wan Qu, asked Gui You Qu.
translations.idiomatic: Qing had a bamboo book that said: 'The Yellow Emperor obtained the treasure ding at Wanqu and asked Gui Youqu.

sentences.zh: 鬼臾區對曰：『［黃］帝得寶鼎神策，是歲己酉朔旦冬至，得天之紀，終而復始。』

translations.literal: Gui You Qu replied: '[Yellow] Emperor obtained treasure ding divine plan, this year Ji You first day winter solstice, obtained heaven order, end and begin again.'
translations.idiomatic: Gui Youqu replied: 'The [Yellow] Emperor obtained the treasure ding and the divine plan. In that year, on the first day of the month Ji You, the winter solstice occurred, and he obtained the order of heaven, ending and beginning again.'

sentences.zh: 於是黃帝迎日推策，後率二十歲復朔旦冬至，凡二十推，三百八十年，黃帝僊登于天。」

translations.literal: Therefore Yellow Emperor welcomed sun pushed plan, after every twenty years again first day winter solstice, altogether twenty pushes, three hundred eighty years, Yellow Emperor immortal ascended to heaven.'
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon, the Yellow Emperor welcomed the sun and pushed the plan. Afterward, every twenty years the first day of the month again coincided with the winter solstice. Altogether there were twenty pushes, and after three hundred and eighty years, the Yellow Emperor became an immortal and ascended to heaven.'

sentences.zh: 卿因所忠欲奏之。

translations.literal: Qing through Suo Zhong wished memorial it.
translations.idiomatic: Qing wished to present it through Suo Zhong.

sentences.zh: 所忠視其書不經，疑其妄書，謝曰：「寶鼎事已決矣，尚何以為！」

translations.literal: Suo Zhong viewed its book not regular, doubted its false book, declined said: 'Treasure ding matter already decided, still what to do!'
translations.idiomatic: Suo Zhong viewed the book and found it irregular, suspecting it was a false book. He declined, saying: 'The matter of the treasure ding has already been decided. What more is there to do!'

sentences.zh: 卿因嬖人奏之。

translations.literal: Qing through favorite person memorialed it.
translations.idiomatic: Qing then presented it through a favorite person.

sentences.zh: 上大說，乃召問卿。

translations.literal: Emperor greatly pleased, then summoned questioned Qing.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor was greatly pleased and summoned Qing to question him.

sentences.zh: 對曰：「受此書申公，申公已死。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Received this book Shen Gong, Shen Gong already dead.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'I received this book from a man named Shen Gong, but Shen Gong is already dead.'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「申公何人也？」

translations.literal: Emperor said: 'Shen Gong what person?'
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: 'Who is Shen Gong?'

sentences.zh: 卿曰：「申公，齊人。

translations.literal: Qing said: 'Shen Gong, Qi person.
translations.idiomatic: Qing said: 'Shen Gong was a man of Qi.

sentences.zh: 與安期生通，受黃帝言，無書，獨有此鼎書。

translations.literal: With An Qisheng communicated, received Yellow Emperor words, no book, only had this ding book.
translations.idiomatic: He communicated with Anqisheng and received the words of the Yellow Emperor. There was no other book, only this ding book.

sentences.zh: 曰『漢興復當黃帝之時』。

translations.literal: Said 'Han rise again should Yellow Emperor time.'
translations.idiomatic: It says: 'The rise of Han should again be at the time of the Yellow Emperor.'

sentences.zh: 曰『漢之聖者在高祖之孫且曾孫也。

translations.literal: Said 'Han sage is Gao Zu grandson and great-grandson.
translations.idiomatic: It says: 'The sage of Han is in the grandson and great-grandson of Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 寶鼎出而與神通，封禪。

translations.literal: Treasure ding out and with gods communicate, feng shan.
translations.idiomatic: When the treasure ding appears and communication with the gods is established, perform the feng and shan.

sentences.zh: 封禪七十二王，唯黃帝得上泰山封』。

translations.literal: Feng shan seventy-two kings, only Yellow Emperor got ascend Tai Shan feng.'
translations.idiomatic: Seventy-two kings performed the feng and shan, but only the Yellow Emperor was able to ascend Mount Tai and perform the feng.'
